disapproval, 1 and 1 she 1 so 1 far 1 conceded 1 to 1 Mr. 1 Beebe 1 as 1 to 1 say 1 that 1 she 1 would 1 only 1 go 1 for 1 a 1 little 1 walk, 1 and 1 keep 1 to 1 the 1 street 1 frequented 1 by 1 1 Beethoven.” 1 Chapter 1 IV: 1 Fourth 1 Chapter 1 Mr. 1 Beebe 1 was 1 right. 1 Lucy 1 never 1 knew 1 her 1 desires 1 so 1 clearly 1 as 1 after 1 music. 1 She 1 had 1 not 1 really 1 appreciated 1 the 1 clergyman’s 1 wit, 1 nor 1 the 1 suggestive 1 twitterings 1 of 1 Miss 1 Alan. 1 Conversation 1 was 1 tedious; 1 she 1 wanted 1 something 1 big, 1 and 1 she 1 believed 1 that 1 it 1 would 1 have 1 come 1 to 1 her 1 on 1 the 1 wind-swept 1 platform 1 of 1 an 1 electric 1 tram. 1 This 1 she 1 might 1 not 1 attempt. 1 It 1 was 1 unladylike. 1 Why? 1 Why 1 were 1 most 1 big 1 things 1 unladylike? 1 Charlotte 1 had 1 once 1 explained 1 to 1 her 1 why. 1 It 1 was 1 not 1 that 1 ladies 1 were 1 inferior 1 to 1 men; 1 it 1 was 1 that 1 they 1 were 1 different. 1 Their 1 mission 1 was 1 to 1 inspire 1 others 1 to 1 achievement 1 rather 1 than 1 to 1 achieve 1 themselves. 1 Indirectly, 1 by 1 means 1 of 1 tact 1 and 1 a 1 spotless 1 name, 1 a 1 lady 1 could 1 accomplish 1 much. 1 But 1 if 1 she 1 rushed 1 into 1 the 1 fray 1 herself 1 she 1 would 1 be 1 first 1 censured, 1 then 1 despised, 1 and 1 finally 1 ignored. 1 Poems 1 had 1 been 1 written 1 to 1 illustrate 1 this 1 point. 1 There 1 is 1 much 1 that 1 is 1 immortal 1 in 1 this 1 medieval 1 lady. 1 The 1 dragons 1 have 1 gone, 1 and 1 so 1 have 1 the 1 knights, 1 but 1 still 1 she 1 lingers 1 in 1 our 1 midst. 1 She 1 reigned 1 in 1 many 1 an 1 early 1 Victorian 1 castle, 1 and 1 was 1 Queen 1 of 1 much 1 early 1 Victorian 1 song. 1 It 1 is 1 sweet 1 to 1 protect 1 her 1 in 1 the 1 intervals 1 of 1 business, 1 sweet 1 to 1 pay 1 her 1 honour 1 when 1 she 1 has 1 cooked 1 our 1 dinner 1 well. 1 But 1 alas! 1 the 1 creature 1 grows 1 degenerate. 1 In 1 her 1 heart 1 also 1 there 1 are 1 springing 1 up 1 strange 1 desires. 1 She 1 too 1 is 1 enamoured 1 of 1 heavy 1 winds, 1 and 1 vast 1 panoramas, 1 and 1 green 1 expanses 1 of 1 the 1 sea. 1 She 1 has 1 marked 1 the 1 kingdom 1 of 1 this 1 world, 1 how 1 full 1 it 1 is 1 of 1 wealth, 1 and 1 beauty, 1 and 1 war--a 1 radiant 1 crust, 1 built 1 around 1 the 1 central 1 fires, 1 spinning 1 towards 1 the 1 receding 1 heavens. 1 Men, 1 declaring 1 that 1 she 1 inspires 1 them 1 to 1 it, 1 move 1 joyfully 1 over 1 the 1 surface, 1 having 1 the 1 most 1 delightful 1 meetings 1 with 1 other 1 men, 1 happy, 1 not 1 because 1 they 1 are 1 masculine, 1 but 1 because 1 they 1 are 1 alive. 1 Before 1 the 1 show 1 breaks 1 up 1 she 1 would 1 like 1 to 1 drop 1 the 1 august 1 title 1 of 1 the 1 Eternal 1 Woman, 1 and 1 go 1 there 1 as 1 her 1 transitory 1 self. 1 Lucy 1 does 1 not 1 stand 1 for 1 the 1 medieval 1 lady, 1 who 1 was 1 rather 1 an 1 ideal 1 to 1 which 1 she 1 was 1 bidden 1 to 1 lift 1 her 1 eyes 1 when 1 feeling 1 serious. 1 Nor 1 has 1 she 1 any 1 system 1 1 debt. 1 “Cinque 1 lire,” 1 they 1 had 1 cried, 1 “cinque 1 lire!” 1 They 1 sparred 1 at 1 each 1 other, 1 and 1 one 1 of 1 them 1 was 1 hit 1 lightly 1 upon 1 the 1 chest. 1 He 1 frowned; 1 he 1
